summary: Faltam dois meses para a última temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos é há 14 novas fotos para...
caption:
Faltam dois meses para a última temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos é há 14 novas fotos para ver https://trendy.pt/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/Game-of-Thrones-14-Temporada-8-1.jpg

Quando estivermos a 14 de Fevereiro, vão faltar exactamente dois meses para estrear a última temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos. E a HBO acaba de partilhar catorze novas fotos das filmagens.

O 14 está muito associado ao mês de Fevereiro, por causa do Dia de São Valentim. Mas, este ano, para os fãs de Game of Thrones o amor manifesta-se de outra maneira: a ver as novas fotografias da oitava temporada da série.

A HBO acaba de partilhar uma colecção com catorze fotografias com Jon Snow, Daenerys Targaryen, Sansa Stark, Tyrion Lannister e outras grandes surpresas.

Curiosamente, a última vez que tínhamos ouvido falar de A Guerra dos Tronos tinha sido a… 14 de Janeiro, altura em que a HBO lançou no YouTube um teaser enigmático com Jon Snow, Ayra Stark e Sansa Stark a entrar numa cripta.

Este vídeo marcou ainda o momento em que foi anunciada a data de estreia da oitava e última temporada de Game of Thrones: o tal dia 14 de Abril.

No princípio de Janeiro tinha saído um outro pequeno clip, que fez parte de um vídeo promocional da HBO com as novidades de 2019 (mostrado durante os Globos de Ouro).

Com cerca de cinco segundos, este preview mostrava Daenerys Targaryen a chegar acompanhada de Jorah Mormont a um local onde estão vários soldados e onde os esperam Jon Snow e Sansa Stark.

De uma rainha para outra, Sansa diz: «Winterfell is yours, your grace»: esta é a única (mas poderosa) linha de diálogo que o clip de Game of Thrones tem.

Ainda em 2018, no primeiro dia de Novembro, já tínhamos ficado a saber como ia começar esta última temporada de uma série da HBO que conquistou milhões de fãs em todo o mundo – se não liga muito a spoilers pode ler tudo aqui.

E já que falamos em HBO, também já sabemos que o serviço de streaming desta produtora vai entrar em Portugal oficialmente pela mão da Vodafone – o anúncio será feito dia 12 de Fevereiro em conferência de imprensa.

Mas vamos ao que interessa: aqui estão as 14 fotos da oitava temporada de A Guerra dos Tronos que a HBO partilhou esta semana com os fãs.

https://is.gd/LZfGXg

summary: the reason a lot of us dislike the sansa-dany ‘friendship’ headcanons is because we know that as soon as sansa is critical of...
body: the reason a lot of us dislike the sansa-dany ‘friendship’ headcanons is because we know that as soon as sansa is critical of dany, dany stans will turn on her. that’s literally what happened in s7. we’re not stupid.

reblog.comment: the reason a lot of us dislike the sansa-dany ‘friendship’ headcanons is because we know that as soon as sansa is critical of dany, dany stans will turn on her. that’s literally what happened in s7. we’re not stupid.

tags: i cant live without my got content
but am not willing to risk being spoiled two months from the goalpost
is there a tag I can blacklist or
summary: GOT Season 8 Leaks Advice
body:
GOT Season 8 Leaks Advice

I literally almost scrolled across a post about the GOT Season 8 leaks/photos. Are these posts tagged in any way so that I don’t see them? I’ve watched it with my mom every year since Season 2 and it’d be seriously infuriating to have the final season spoiled for me. Any advice would be helpful.

summary: I can't figure out why Game of Thrones fandom keeps assaulting Sansa or Daenerys about the chance they might become dark Sansa...
body:
I can’t figure out why Game of Thrones fandom keeps assaulting Sansa or Daenerys about the chance they might become dark Sansa and dark Daenerys. It’s a path for fictional characters’s storylines that has been existing in literature, cinema and television since always. Always.

Character development:

  • Progression
  • Regression 

We’ve already seen and read about it in the medias, so which is the reason that make you assault them so violently? Why? Explain it to me, because fictional characters going through a character regression isn’t new to any of us.

I don’t understand why you’re constantly bullying both of them about it, outside the fact that I don’t think Sansa or Daenerys will exterminate everything and everyone. 

I like the memes, the well done gifsets (there are very well done gifsets about dark Sansa and dark Daenerys) and the jokes, but bullying is never, ever an option for me. 

(*) This post has no intention to debate on Daenerys’s Targaryen figure, because even if I disagree with some of her methods I still consider her a very tragical character like many others in Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire universes.

blog.description: Author and Fan of too many fandoms

summary: I’ve seen a lot of comparisons between the Daenerys/Barristan scene with the Daenerys/Jon scene, where she notices that Jon is...
body:
I’ve seen a lot of comparisons between the Daenerys/Barristan scene with the Daenerys/Jon scene, where she notices that Jon is in a lot of ways like her brother, as in he doesn’t enjoy what he’s good at, aka killing.

But Dany is the one who mentions it, which I’d interpret as she knows she’s good at killing people, mainly with her dragons burning them and she enjoys it.

While Jon doesn’t.

Which would make him a better person in the eyes of Dany and the viewers.
